recommendations.name: Family Weeknight Omnivore Classics (Halal-friendly)
recommendations.notes: Overlaps with arch_3e2c1a on mainstream omnivore family weeknights. Keep but clarify Halal posture and standardize tags. Remove nonstandard core_tags.Allergens and add clear allergen stance in description.

suggested_changes.description: Broad-appeal halal-friendly dinners for South African families: mild, 15–30 minute, simple stovetop or sheet-pan meals with affordable spend and familiar SA/Modern American comfort profiles. Not allergen-safe; contains common allergens unless user filters. Avoids pork and alcohol per halal norms.

recommendations.name: Family Veggie Weeknight Classics
recommendations.notes: One of three very similar family vegetarian weeknight baselines. Convert this variant to DairyFree-focused to satisfy the brief’s dedicated dairy-free archetype requirement and reduce overlap.

suggested_changes.description: Balanced, kid-friendly vegetarian dinners for South African and Modern American palates; dairy-free by default to serve the dairy-free cohort. Mild flavors, 15–30 minutes, simple steps, and a Balanced spend. Eggs optional; plant-based substitutes provided where helpful.

recommendations.name: Solo Quick Bites Flex
recommendations.notes: Overlaps with arch_8f2k9x and arch_3a1b9k (solo under-15, familiar, value). Keep but differentiate via NoHeat for sensitive solo diners and reinforce nut/shellfish avoidance as a nut-free solo baseline.

suggested_changes.description: Ultra-fast, one-pan or air-fryer-friendly meals for solo diners who are flexitarian. No-heat seasoning for sensitive palates, Under-15-minute prep, Simple steps, ValueStaples budget. Defaults are nut-free and shellfish-free; swap-ins optional.

recommendations.name: Mediterranean Pescatarian Date-Night
recommendations.notes: Distinct couple-focused pescatarian with shellfish-free guardrail and Intermediate complexity; meets cuisine, audience, budget, and allergen requirements.

recommendations.name: Gluten-Aware Sheet-Pan Meal Prep Basics
recommendations.notes: Provides GlutenAware MealPrep with 45Plus hands-off and NoHeat; satisfies allergen-safe gluten-free cohort.

recommendations.name: Family Poultry-Only SA Twists
recommendations.notes: Overlaps with arch_3q1h2k (both poultry-only family mild weeknights). Differentiate by shifting to Intermediate complexity and adding simple glazing/roasting techniques.

suggested_changes.description: Family-friendly poultry dinners with South African staples and gentle regional twists; mild spice, 15–30 minutes, Intermediate techniques (quick marinades, pan sauces), Balanced budget; avoids fish/shellfish and suits kosher-style households avoiding red meat or pork.

recommendations.name: Vegan High-Protein Meal Prep Bowls (Global Explorer)
recommendations.notes: Good coverage, but clarify gluten posture and soy default to align with allergen guardrails; remove core_tags.Allergens.

suggested_changes.description: Batch-cook vegan bowls for MealPrep households using affordable pantry staples with Mediterranean/Middle Eastern flavors; Medium heat, Simple steps, 30–45 minutes. Defaults avoid dairy, egg, fish, shellfish, peanuts, and tree nuts; sesame/mustard may appear. Soy is optional opt-in; gluten kept minimal with GF swaps noted.

recommendations.name: Jain-Friendly Weeknight Vegan Classics
recommendations.notes: Overlaps with arch_1k7p9f (both Jain-friendly vegan family, 15–30, NoHeat). Differentiate this one by setting Indian-only cuisine and ValueStaples budget, while keeping the other as Indo-SA mix and HighProtein.

suggested_changes.description: Fast, no-heat Indian familiar classics tailored for Jain-friendly vegan family dinners on a ValueStaples budget; avoids root vegetables and animal products while keeping flavors gentle for kids.

recommendations.name: Shellfish-Free Pescatarian Entertaining Showstopper
recommendations.notes: Solid entertaining Showstopper but we need LuxuryExperience representation and at least one Hot/ExtraHot band. Shift budget to LuxuryExperience and heat to Hot to provide an opt-in premium spicy lane.

suggested_changes.description: A luxury, guest-ready pescatarian spread with EastAsian GlobalExplorer vibes that stays shellfish-free, gluten-free, and nut-free by design; Hot heat band, 45+ minute hands-off-and-finish cooking with Showstopper presentation for Entertaining.

recommendations.name: Family Low-Carb Weeknight Basics
recommendations.notes: Strong baseline but we need more Intermediate/Advanced coverage. Elevate to Intermediate with quick sauté-plus-sauce sequences without raising time/budget.

suggested_changes.description: Everyday low-carb family dinners with quick skillet and sheet-pan staples; 15–30 minutes, Intermediate techniques (deglazing, pan sauces), Mild heat, Affordable budget; ModernAmerican and Mediterranean familiar flavors.

recommendations.name: Kosher-Style Flex Meal Prep (Mediterranean & Middle Eastern)
recommendations.notes: Covers Kosher-style ethics + MealPrep at Intermediate and Balanced; distinct and aligned.

recommendations.name: Family Omnivore Weeknight Classics
recommendations.notes: Overlaps with arch_2p9k1f; keep as the non-ethics baseline but standardize tags and remove core_tags.Allergens.

suggested_changes.description: Balanced, kid-friendly omnivore dinners for SA/Modern American weeknights: quick two-pan mains with veg sides, affordable staples, mild seasoning, and clear swap notes for common allergens—ideal for families needing 15–30 minute, Simple meals.

recommendations.name: Vegetarian Family Weeknight Classics
recommendations.notes: Substantial overlap with arch_7e3a9b and arch_3k9x8h. Use this slot to add a missing cuisine/openness/heat/budget: LatinAmerican, Hot, RegionalTwist/GlobalExplorer, and Affordable/Balanced family profile.

replacement_proposal.name: Family Latin American Fiesta Nights (Hot, RegionalTwist, Balanced)
replacement_proposal.concept_summary: Diet: Omnivore; Cuisine: LatinAmerican; CuisineOpenness: RegionalTwist; PrepTime: 30to45; Complexity: Intermediate; HeatSpice: Hot (opt-in); Audience: Family; BudgetLevel: Balanced; EthicsReligious: []; Allergen posture: not allergen-safe, with clear swaps for gluten/dairy. Purpose: Fill LatinAmerican + Hot + Intermediate + family gap.

recommendations.name: Solo Value Staples Quick Bites (Air-Fry & Stovetop)
recommendations.notes: Overlaps with arch_3b4f9k and arch_3a1b9k. Differentiate by setting Heat to Mild and explicitly focusing on AirFry format to align with Occasion/Format anchors.

suggested_changes.description: Ultra-fast single-serve meals using pantry staples and freezer-friendly basics for solo eaters; Omnivore/Flex-friendly, Mild heat, Under-15, Simple, ValueStaples budget, with an explicit AirFry-first approach and stovetop alternates.

recommendations.name: Couple Omnivore Weeknight Classics (SA & Modern American)
recommendations.notes: Good couple baseline; formalize as dedicated NutFree archetype to meet allergen-safe nut-free cohort requirement.

suggested_changes.description: Fast, comforting omnivore dinners for two with SA/Modern American flavors; Mild heat, 15–30 minutes, Simple, Balanced budget. Dedicated nut-free posture by default (avoids peanuts and tree nuts); shellfish optional and clearly flagged.

recommendations.name: Family Gluten-Aware Weeknight Basics
recommendations.notes: Meets mainstream gluten-aware family baseline with Halal alignment; complements MealPrep gluten-aware.

recommendations.name: Halal-Friendly Poultry Weeknight Classics (Family)
recommendations.notes: Overlaps with arch_2s9h3k. Differentiate by setting CuisineOpenness to RegionalTwist (already set) and shifting PrepTime to 30–45 to broaden prep-time distribution.

suggested_changes.description: Family-friendly poultry-only dinners with South African and Mediterranean comfort flavors; mild heat, 30–45 minutes, simple steps, balanced budget, and explicit avoidance of fish and shellfish for straightforward halal-aligned weeknights.

recommendations.name: Couple Vegetarian Cozy Evenings (Mediterranean & Modern American)
recommendations.notes: Distinct couple vegetarian at Intermediate complexity and 30–45 timing; keep for balance.

recommendations.name: Jain-Friendly Vegan Weeknight Basics (No-Heat, Affordable Family)
recommendations.notes: Overlaps with arch_5u6h1q, but retains HighProtein tag. Clarify HighProtein emphasis and keep Indo–SouthAfrican blend; remove core_tags.Allergens.

suggested_changes.description: Family-friendly vegan dinners with Jain guardrails (no root vegetables), no-heat seasoning, quick 15–30 minute steps, Affordable spend, and a deliberate HighProtein emphasis via legume/grain pairings using Indian and South African staples.

recommendations.name: Pescatarian Mediterranean Entertaining (Shellfish-Free)
recommendations.notes: Advanced entertaining is valuable. Shift heat to Hot to increase hot-band coverage; keep PremiumOccasion to preserve budget distribution.

suggested_changes.description: Advanced, hot, fish-focused Mediterranean menus for small gatherings; shellfish-free by design, PremiumOccasion budget, 30–45 minutes active with advanced techniques; aligned to South African kitchens.

recommendations.name: Vegan High-Protein Meal Prep (SE Asia, Hands-Off)
recommendations.notes: Good plant-forward MealPrep. To diversify heat bands, set this to ExtraHot with explicit opt-in, and clarify nut/sesame optionality.

suggested_changes.description: Plant-based, protein-focused batch cooks with hands-off methods for budget-savvy meal preppers; Southeast Asian flavors, ExtraHot (opt-in), Affordable spend, clear avoidance of dairy/egg/fish/shellfish; soy included by default, nuts/sesame optional add-ons.

recommendations.name: Family Flexitarian Regional Twists (SA & Mediterranean, 15-30, Mild, Balanced)
recommendations.notes: Solid mainstream flexitarian family. Convert complexity to Intermediate to help balance tier counts without changing time/heat.

suggested_changes.description: Balanced weeknight recipes for families who mix veg-forward meals with occasional lean meats; Mild for kids, 15–30 minutes, Intermediate steps (multi-component build), Balanced budget, South African staples with Mediterranean twists.

recommendations.name: Couple Low-Carb Global Explorer (East Asian, 15–30, Medium, Affordable)
recommendations.notes: Meets LowCarb adventurous couple need. Adjust to Hot to increase hot-band coverage and clarify low-sugar sauces.

suggested_changes.description: For adventurous couples eating low-carb on a budget: East Asian-inspired, hot dishes ready in 15–30 minutes with Intermediate steps; uses low-sugar sauces and grain-free sides.

recommendations.name: Family Vegetarian Weeknight Classics (SA & Modern American, 15–30, Mild, Affordable)
recommendations.notes: Third overlap in vegetarian family classics. Use this slot to add an ExperimentalFusion, LuxuryExperience Showstopper for Entertaining to satisfy missing openness and budget tiers.

replacement_proposal.name: Experimental Fusion Entertaining (LuxuryExperience, Showstopper)
replacement_proposal.concept_summary: Diet: Omnivore; Cuisine: SouthAfrican, EastAsian, Mediterranean (fusion); CuisineOpenness: ExperimentalFusion; PrepTime: 45Plus; Complexity: Showstopper; HeatSpice: Medium; Audience: Entertaining; BudgetLevel: LuxuryExperience; Allergen posture: not allergen-safe; provide swap notes. Purpose: Fill ExperimentalFusion + LuxuryExperience + Showstopper gap.

recommendations.name: Solo 10-Minute Omnivore Quick Bites (Value Staples)
recommendations.notes: Overlaps with two other solo quick-bite baselines. Replace with a Keto archetype per required diet coverage.

replacement_proposal.name: Keto Couple Steak-Night (Modern American & SA, 30–45, Advanced)
replacement_proposal.concept_summary: Diet: Keto, Omnivore; Cuisine: ModernAmerican, SouthAfrican; CuisineOpenness: FamiliarClassics; PrepTime: 30to45; Complexity: Advanced; HeatSpice: Medium; Audience: Couple; BudgetLevel: PremiumOccasion; Allergen posture: dairy-optional; nut-free default. Purpose: Cover missing Keto with a non-weeknight baseline and shift complexity upward.

overlap_clusters.reason: All three are Vegetarian family weeknight classics: Mild heat, 15–30, Familiar SA/Modern American with Balanced/Affordable budgets.
Solo Under-15 familiar quick bites with ValueStaples budgets; two Omnivore and one Flexitarian.
Family weeknight omnivore classics, Mild, 15–30, Affordable, Familiar SA/Modern American; one Halal-friendly.
Family PoultryOnly, Mild, Familiar SA flavors with religious guardrails (Kosher-style vs Halal).
Gluten-aware omnivore basics for families/meal-prep; NoHeat sheet-pan 45Plus vs 15–30 weeknights.
Jain-friendly vegan family weeknights, NoHeat, Affordable, Indian-led; one has HighProtein and Indo–SA blend.
Pescatarian entertaining with shellfish-free stance; different cuisines and complexity (Advanced vs Showstopper).

missing_areas: Keto diet archetype (any audience) – required by brief.
LatinAmerican cuisine coverage for non-entertaining contexts.
Hot and ExtraHot dedicated archetypes for adventurous users.
Dedicated Dairy-free archetype (now addressed via modification, but ensure QA).
Dedicated Nut-free archetype (now addressed via modification, but ensure QA).
Complexity distribution: Intermediate/Advanced/Showstopper tiers require more entries (target ≥6 each).

summary.notes: Dataset hits 25 entries (within 24–28) and covers most diet/audience/cuisine basics. Gaps: no Keto, no NorthAfrican, limited LatinAmerican, no ExperimentalFusion, weak Hot/ExtraHot and LuxuryExperience presence, and heavy bias toward Simple complexity. Recommended changes reduce overlap, standardize allergen tag usage (remove nonstandard core_tags.Allergens; rely on allergen_flags), add Dairy-free and Nut-free dedicated postures, introduce Hot/ExtraHot and LuxuryExperience, and rebalance complexities by upgrading several archetypes. Next steps: implement modifications and replacements, then re-audit complexity counts to achieve ≥6 per tier, and add one NorthAfrican-focused archetype in a future swap if further overlap remains.
